ai.summary: A gentle 5.5 km circular walk along the Eckington Wharf riverside in the UK. The route is easy, well-surfaced in parts, and suitable for families and beginners looking for a relaxed urban–riverside circuit with possible views of the river and local wharf.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat or gently undulating paths including riverside walkways, some gravel sections, and a short section of boardwalk near the wharf. Expect mixed surfaces and occasional damp patches.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and tide times for the river area. Wear sturdy, comfortable footwear and bring a waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, keep children and dogs under control near the water, and be mindful of other users on shared paths. Bring water on warmer days and know your limits.
recommended_gear: Charged phone and portable power bank
ai.best_seasons: All year round, with particularly pleasant conditions in spring and autumn; summer can be warmer, and winter walks are possible in daylight.
